trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to an iOS application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to an iOS application.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to an iOS application.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to an iOS application.

trans-unit.source: You'll create a blank iOS app that receives push notifications by using the Apple Push Notification service (APNs).
trans-unit.target: You'll create a blank iOS app that receives push notifications by using the Apple Push Notification service (APNs).

trans-unit.source: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.
trans-unit.target: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: [Mobile Services iOS SDK]
trans-unit.target: [Mobile Services iOS SDK]

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Xcode 6[install xcode]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Xcode 6[install xcode]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: An iOS 8 (or later version) capable device
trans-unit.target: An iOS 8 (or later version) capable device

trans-unit.source: iOS Developer Program membership
trans-unit.target: iOS Developer Program membership

trans-unit.source: Because of configuration requirements for push notifications, you must deploy and test push notifications on an iOS capable device (iPhone or iPad) instead of the iOS Simulator.
trans-unit.target: Because of configuration requirements for push notifications, you must deploy and test push notifications on an iOS capable device (iPhone or iPad) instead of the iOS Simulator.

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure your notification hub
trans-unit.target: Configure your notification hub

trans-unit.source: This section walks you through creating and configuring a new notification hub by using the push certificate that you created.
trans-unit.target: This section walks you through creating and configuring a new notification hub by using the push certificate that you created.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a notification hub that you have already created, you can skip steps 2–5.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a notification hub that you have already created, you can skip steps 2–5.

trans-unit.source: In Keychain Access, right-click the new push certificate that you created in the Certificates category.
trans-unit.target: In Keychain Access, right-click the new push certificate that you created in the Certificates category.

trans-unit.source: Click Export, name the file, select the .p12 format, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Export, name the file, select the .p12 format, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the file name and location of the exported certificate.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the file name and location of the exported certificate.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial creates a QuickStart.p12 file.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial creates a QuickStart.p12 file.

trans-unit.source: Your file name and location might be different.
trans-unit.target: Your file name and location might be different.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click App Services, click Service Bus, click Notification Hub, and then click Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click App Services, click Service Bus, click Notification Hub, and then click Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a new Notification Hub.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a new Notification Hub.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace that you just created (usually *notification hub name*-ns) to open its dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace that you just created (usually *notification hub name*-ns) to open its dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Click the Notification Hubs tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the Notification Hubs tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the Configure tab at the top, and then click the Upload button in the Apple notification settings to upload the certificate thumbprint.
trans-unit.target: Click the Configure tab at the top, and then click the Upload button in the Apple notification settings to upload the certificate thumbprint.

trans-unit.source: Then select the .p12 certificate that you exported earlier, and the password for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Then select the .p12 certificate that you exported earlier, and the password for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to select whether you want to use the Production (if you want to send push notifications to users who purchased your app from the store) or the Sandbox (during development) push service.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to select whether you want to use the Production (if you want to send push notifications to users who purchased your app from the store) or the Sandbox (during development) push service.

trans-unit.source: Click the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click View Connection String.
trans-unit.target: Click the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click View Connection String.

trans-unit.source: Take note of the two connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the two connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Your notification hub is now configured to work with APNs, and you have the connection strings to register your app and send notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your notification hub is now configured to work with APNs, and you have the connection strings to register your app and send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, create a new iOS project and select the Single View Application template.
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, create a new iOS project and select the Single View Application template.

trans-unit.source: When setting the options for your new project, make sure to use the same Product Name and Organization Identifier that you used when you previously set the bundle ID on the Apple Developer portal.
trans-unit.target: When setting the options for your new project, make sure to use the same Product Name and Organization Identifier that you used when you previously set the bundle ID on the Apple Developer portal.

trans-unit.source: Under Targets, click your project name, click the Build Settings tab and expand Code Signing Identity, and then under Debug, set your code-signing identity.
trans-unit.target: Under Targets, click your project name, click the Build Settings tab and expand Code Signing Identity, and then under Debug, set your code-signing identity.

trans-unit.source: Toggle Levels from Basic to All, and set Provisioning Profile to the provisioning profile that you created previously.
trans-unit.target: Toggle Levels from Basic to All, and set Provisioning Profile to the provisioning profile that you created previously.

trans-unit.source: If you don't see the new provisioning profile that you created in Xcode, try refreshing the profiles for your signing identity.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see the new provisioning profile that you created in Xcode, try refreshing the profiles for your signing identity.

trans-unit.source: Click Xcode on the menu bar, click Preferences, click the Account tab, click the View Details button, click your signing identity, and then click the refresh button in the bottom-right corner.
trans-unit.target: Click Xcode on the menu bar, click Preferences, click the Account tab, click the View Details button, click your signing identity, and then click the refresh button in the bottom-right corner.

trans-unit.source: Download version 1.2.4 of the [Mobile Services iOS SDK] and unzip the file.
trans-unit.target: Download version 1.2.4 of the [Mobile Services iOS SDK] and unzip the file.

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, right-click your project and click the Add Files to option to add the WindowsAzureMessaging.framework folder to your Xcode project.
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, right-click your project and click the Add Files to option to add the WindowsAzureMessaging.framework folder to your Xcode project.

trans-unit.source: Select Copy items if needed, and then click Add.
trans-unit.target: Select Copy items if needed, and then click Add.

trans-unit.source: Open your AppDelegate.h file add the following import directive:
trans-unit.target: Open your AppDelegate.h file add the following import directive:

trans-unit.source: In your AppDelegate.m file, add the following code in the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions method based on your version of iOS.
trans-unit.target: In your AppDelegate.m file, add the following code in the didFinishLaunchingWithOptions method based on your version of iOS.

trans-unit.target: This code registers your device handle with APNs:

trans-unit.target: For iOS 8:

trans-unit.target: For iOS versions prior to 8:

trans-unit.source: In the same file, add the following methods and replace the string literal placeholders with your hub name and the DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature that you noted earlier.
trans-unit.target: In the same file, add the following methods and replace the string literal placeholders with your hub name and the DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature that you noted earlier.

trans-unit.source: This code gives the device token to the notification hub so that the notification hub can send notifications:
trans-unit.target: This code gives the device token to the notification hub so that the notification hub can send notifications:

trans-unit.source: In the same file, add the following method to display a UIAlert if the notification is received while the app is active:
trans-unit.target: In the same file, add the following method to display a UIAlert if the notification is received while the app is active:

trans-unit.source: Build and run the app on your device to verify that there are no failures.
trans-unit.target: Build and run the app on your device to verify that there are no failures.

trans-unit.source: Send notifications
trans-unit.target: Send notifications

trans-unit.source: You can test receiving notifications in your app by sending notifications in the Azure portal via the debug tab on the notification hub, as shown in the screen below.
trans-unit.target: You can test receiving notifications in your app by sending notifications in the Azure portal via the debug tab on the notification hub, as shown in the screen below.

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, open Main.storyboard and add the following UI components from the object library to allow the user to send push notifications in the app:
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, open Main.storyboard and add the following UI components from the object library to allow the user to send push notifications in the app:

trans-unit.source: A label with no label text.
trans-unit.target: A label with no label text.

trans-unit.source: It will be used to report errors in sending notifications.
trans-unit.target: It will be used to report errors in sending notifications.

trans-unit.source: The Lines property should be set to 0 so that it will automatically size constrained to the right and left margins and the top of the view.
trans-unit.target: The Lines property should be set to 0 so that it will automatically size constrained to the right and left margins and the top of the view.

trans-unit.source: A text field with Placeholder text set to Enter Notification Message.
trans-unit.target: A text field with Placeholder text set to Enter Notification Message.

trans-unit.source: Constrain the field just below the label as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Constrain the field just below the label as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Set the View Controller as the outlet delegate.
trans-unit.target: Set the View Controller as the outlet delegate.

trans-unit.source: A button titled Send Notification constrained just below the text field and in the horizontal center.
trans-unit.target: A button titled Send Notification constrained just below the text field and in the horizontal center.

trans-unit.source: The view should look as follows:
trans-unit.target: The view should look as follows:

trans-unit.source: Open your ViewController.h file and add the following #import and #define statements.
trans-unit.target: Open your ViewController.h file and add the following #import and #define statements.

trans-unit.source: Replace the placeholder string literal with your actual DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature connection string and hub name.
trans-unit.target: Replace the placeholder string literal with your actual DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature connection string and hub name.

trans-unit.source: Add outlets for the label and text field connected your view, and update your interface definition to support UITextFieldDelegate and NSXMLParserDelegate.
trans-unit.target: Add outlets for the label and text field connected your view, and update your interface definition to support UITextFieldDelegate and NSXMLParserDelegate.

trans-unit.source: Add the three property declarations shown below to help support calling the REST API and parsing the response.
trans-unit.target: Add the three property declarations shown below to help support calling the REST API and parsing the response.

trans-unit.source: Your ViewController.h file should look as follows:
trans-unit.target: Your ViewController.h file should look as follows:

trans-unit.source: Open ViewController.m and add the following code to parse your DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature connection string.
trans-unit.target: Open ViewController.m and add the following code to parse your DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature connection string.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in the REST API reference, this parsed information will be used to generate a SaS token for the Authorization request header.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned in the REST API reference, this parsed information will be used to generate a SaS token for the Authorization request header.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, update the viewDidLoad method to parse the connection string when the view loads.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, update the viewDidLoad method to parse the connection string when the view loads.

trans-unit.source: Also add the utility methods shown below.
trans-unit.target: Also add the utility methods shown below.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, add the following code to generate the SaS authorization token that will be provided in the Authorization header, as mentioned in the REST API Reference.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, add the following code to generate the SaS authorization token that will be provided in the Authorization header, as mentioned in the REST API Reference.

trans-unit.source: Ctrl+drag from the Send Notification button to ViewController.m to add an action for the Touch Down event that executes the REST API call by using the following code.
trans-unit.target: Ctrl+drag from the Send Notification button to ViewController.m to add an action for the Touch Down event that executes the REST API call by using the following code.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, add the following delegate method to support closing the keyboard for the text field.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, add the following delegate method to support closing the keyboard for the text field.

trans-unit.source: Ctrl+drag from the text field to the View Controller icon in the interface designer to set the view controller as the outlet delegate.
trans-unit.target: Ctrl+drag from the text field to the View Controller icon in the interface designer to set the view controller as the outlet delegate.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, add the following delegate methods to support parsing the response by using NSXMLParser.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, add the following delegate methods to support parsing the response by using NSXMLParser.

trans-unit.source: Build the project and verify that there are no errors.
trans-unit.target: Build the project and verify that there are no errors.

trans-unit.source: You can find all the possible notification payloads in the Apple [Local and Push Notification Programming Guide].
trans-unit.target: You can find all the possible notification payloads in the Apple [Local and Push Notification Programming Guide].

trans-unit.source: Test your app
trans-unit.target: Test your app

trans-unit.source: To test push notifications on iOS, you must deploy the app to a device.
trans-unit.target: To test push notifications on iOS, you must deploy the app to a device.

trans-unit.source: You cannot send Apple push notifications by using the iOS Simulator.
trans-unit.target: You cannot send Apple push notifications by using the iOS Simulator.

trans-unit.source: Run the app and verify that registration succeeds, and then press OK.
trans-unit.target: Run the app and verify that registration succeeds, and then press OK.

trans-unit.source: Touch inside the text field to enter a notification message.
trans-unit.target: Touch inside the text field to enter a notification message.

trans-unit.source: Then press the Send button on the keyboard or the Send Notification button in the view to send the notification message.
trans-unit.target: Then press the Send button on the keyboard or the Send Notification button in the view to send the notification message.

trans-unit.source: The notification is sent to all devices that are registered to receive the notification.
trans-unit.target: The notification is sent to all devices that are registered to receive the notification.

trans-unit.source: If you have any problems or recommendations for improving this tutorial for all readers, please leave us a comment in the Disqus section below.
trans-unit.target: If you have any problems or recommendations for improving this tutorial for all readers, please leave us a comment in the Disqus section below.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance].
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance].
